titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 53

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 20 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 53; Qurʾānic Text: Q 26:1-26:129; 6 lines per page; Dimensions: 259 x 182mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragment Arabe 325 (c) (BNF) probably belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 53
20 fol. 182×259 mm (1.42). Support: parchment, thin to average thickness, transparent, rigid, of yellowish color with traces of polishing. Writing material: black ink.
Collation: two quires, in both two outer and two inner pairs are bifolia, fol. 3, 8, 13, and 18 are singletons with stubs.
I: H1F H2F H3F S H4F H5F / F6H F7H F8H S F9H F10H;
II: H11F H12F H13F S H14F H15F / F16H F17H F18H S F19H F20H;
Text layout: 89/90×175/180 mm (1.875/2.0), 6 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: red dots, occasionally also green and black dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – diagonal dashes (type 1.1.3) in the same ink as the main text; for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā); for groups of ten verses – medallion (type 2.A.II) in the text line, in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses signified according to the abjad system (fol. 3r, 4v, 6v, 8r, 10r, 11r, 12v, 14r, 15v, 16v, 18v,19v).

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs and verses inscribed in pencil on the upper margins of all sheets in Roman and Arabic letters; numbers of surahs and verses also inscribed in ink in the text of the first and last page of the manuscript.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather of the spine?).
Traces of old conservation: upper outer corners trimmed.
Defects: stains; traces of moisture on fol. 5-6; margins damaged, probably by rodents; parchment damaged by aggressive ink on fol. 1, 8–9, 20; ink peeling off on the flesh side.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the letters “BC”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink and old accession number in red pencil “B. 31”.
Old accession numbers: ВС (on the wrapping), B. 31 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–20v. Surah 26, verses 1(1)-129(129). Incipit: بسم الل الرحمن الرحيم . Explicit:: مصانع [لعلّكم تخلدون] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: probably, Arabe 325c (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
